title: Commending the Nassau County Junior Firefighters Association upon the occasion of its 5th Annual Installation Dinner, and honoring this years elected junior officials
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION commending the Nassau County Junior Firefighters
Association upon the occasion of its 5th Annual Installation Dinner, and
honoring this years elected junior officials

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize  and  pay
tribute  to  those  young  people within the great Empire State who have
made strong contributions to their communities and  who  serve  as  role
models for their peers; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commend
the  Nassau  County Junior Firefighters Association upon the occasion of
its 5th Annual Installation Dinner, honoring this years  elected  junior
officials, to be held on Saturday, January 22, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  Our  firefighters  are  greatly  supported by the service of
dedicated individuals who volunteer their time and energies to the effi-
cient operation of their fire departments; and
  WHEREAS, The junior firefighter programs of Nassau County allows young
people to learn about volunteer  firefighting,  train  with  experienced
firefighters, and in some places, assist at fire scenes; and
  WHEREAS, There are presently 33 fire departments in Nassau County that
have  a Junior Program, which total over 400 junior members ranging from
ages 14 to 18; and
  WHEREAS, The exemplary youths  designated  for  the  esteemed  elected
positions,  based  upon  their  merit,  dedication  and  experience are:
Henrietta McDonald for President, Donald Bruschi for 1st Vice President,
Jonathan Chambers for 2nd Vice President, Joseph Velotti for  Secretary,
Dale Warwick for Treasurer, and Andrew Mach for Sergeant of Arms; and
  WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body that we should give
special recognition to those young individuals who work  so  assiduously
for  the  betterment  of their communities, and acknowledge publicly the
heroic good works performed by the fire departments of this great Empire
State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend the Nassau County Junior Firefighters Association upon the occa-
sion of its 5th Annual Installation Dinner, and honor this years elected
junior officials; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  the  Nassau County Junior Firefighters Association, and the
aforementioned junior officials.
